byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

abstract: Afghan Gen Abdul Jabar Qahraman returns to Helmand Province, area he surrendered to mujahedeen guerillas in 1993, this time to keep region from falling to Taliban; Qahraman’s insistence to negotiate with Taliban, who now control majority of province’s districts, along with army’s abandonment of its last bases, creates fear history will repeat itself.

headline.print_headline: A Leader Confronts the Taliban and His Past
headline.main: Facing the Taliban and His Past, an Afghan Leader Aims for a Different Ending

snippet: Abdul Jabar Qahraman, who surrendered Lashkar Gah to rebels two decades ago, has returned as President Ashraf Ghani’s representative and tried to negotiate, rather than fight, with today’s insurgents.
lead_paragraph: Abdul Jabar Qahraman, who surrendered Lashkar Gah to rebels two decades ago, has returned as President Ashraf Ghani’s representative and tried to negotiate, rather than fight, with today’s insurgents.
